messages.subject: Re: dads
messages.msgSnippet: Such sweetness as you describe below, Nanci, is what makes life more than wonderful. I don t mind if you go on.  I can never hear enough because it allows me
messages.messageBody:
Such sweetness as you describe below, Nanci, is what makes life more than
wonderful. I don't mind if you go on. I can never hear enough because it
allows me to appreciate my own joy with my dear daughters!

Thomas and Nanci Kuykendall wrote:

> My children (both boys) are absolutely and without a doubt devoted
> completely to their father and have been since even before birth. When I
> was pregnant with my first child he was very busy and active in utero and
> only Daddy's voice and hands on my belly got him to settle down at night.
> The same has been true for them since they were born. They call out for
> Daddy in the night (usually) the copy his mannerisms and phrases or
> sayings, they follow him around they house and drop everything to run into
> his arms when he gets home at night. At the dinner table, when Daddy takes
> a drink the 2.5 year old does too, if he takes a bite of food, so does my
> toddler. They LOOOOVE to cuddle with their father and play games with him
> and they play Daddies and Babies with thier toy animals and dinosaurs at
> least as often as they play Mommies and Babies. They stand at the window
> by the front door and look down the street for their father when he is at
> work frequently, they prefer Daddy to read their bedtime story...I could go
> on, but you all get the idea.
>
> Nanci K. in Idaho
>

best wishes
Joel

All children behave as well as they are treated. The Natural Child
Project http://naturalchild.com/home/

Work together to reinvent justice using methods that are fair; which conserve,
restore and even create harmony, equity and good will in society i.e.
restorative justice.
We are the prisoners of the prisoners we have taken - J. Clegg
http://www.cerj.org

messages.subject: Re: dads
messages.msgSnippet: Although,  now our first is such a daddy s girl, it s not even funny!!! She loves mom, but when dad walks in the room her face lights up like a Christmas tree!
messages.messageBody:
Although, now our first is such a daddy's girl, it's not even funny!!!
She loves mom, but when dad walks in the room her face lights up like a
Christmas tree! So, I guess I had my time and now it's his. It eventually
balances out, I guess.
Faith

My children (both boys) are absolutely and without a doubt devoted
completely to their father and have been since even before birth. When I
was pregnant with my first child he was very busy and active in utero and
only Daddy's voice and hands on my belly got him to settle down at night.
The same has been true for them since they were born. They call out for
Daddy in the night (usually) the copy his mannerisms and phrases or
sayings, they follow him around they house and drop everything to run into
his arms when he gets home at night. At the dinner table, when Daddy takes
a drink the 2.5 year old does too, if he takes a bite of food, so does my
toddler. They LOOOOVE to cuddle with their father and play games with him
and they play Daddies and Babies with thier toy animals and dinosaurs at
least as often as they play Mommies and Babies. They stand at the window
by the front door and look down the street for their father when he is at
work frequently, they prefer Daddy to read their bedtime story...I could go
on, but you all get the idea.

Nanci K. in Idaho
